transcript.text: We think tomorrow will be a better day.

Yes, it is possible,
because impossible is not French.

We are convinced that France has a destiny,
that the French have a destiny.
The French have been here for a thousand years,

and they want to be here
for another thousand years.
Therefore, our duty is to preserve our heritage,

to cultivate our way of life,
to pass down our civilization.
To do this, we are going to need our businesses.
They must be ready to produce, to innovate,
in order to conquer the world.

We are going to need French people
who make good livings,
who are no longer anxious about making ends meet.

We want to be this solid, robust, proud nation
full of self-confidence again.

Confidence in its labor,
confidence in its genius.

I want to infuse France
with this spirit of reconquest!

We have a country to reconquer,
we have an economy to reconquer!
Nothing and no one will make us scorn our country,

its economy, its workers
and the fruits of their efforts!

Nothing and no one will make us forget
that we were born in prosperity,

that it enlightened our past,
and that it is awaiting us in our future!

Nothing and no one will make us
abandon our parents,

our children, our desires,
our ambitions, our projects!

Nothing and no one will prevent us from
living in our country, for our people!
They will not downgrade us!
They will not subdue us!
They will not replace us!

They will have to rip our hearts out,
but they will fail!
Because courage, that's us!
Panache, that's us!

The flag that flutters in the wind of history,
that's us!
The nation that does not submit, that's us!
The land that refuses to yield, that's us!

The proud people that is no longer scared,
that's us!
The Reconquest, that's us!

Long live our intelligence, long live our labor,
long live our greatness,

long live everyone we love,
long live everything we create,

long live the Republic, but most importantly,
long live France!
